results.title: Kanha National Park
results.brief_description: Kanha National Park in the hills of Madhya Pradesh. The park is noted for its rare Indian swamp deer, together with spotted deer, black buck antelope, tigers, langur, and Indian bison.
results.description: Kanha National Park in the hills of Madhya Pradesh. The park is noted for its rare Indian swamp deer, together with spotted deer, black buck antelope, tigers, langur, and Indian bison.

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 2. Varieties [Italian version]
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, David Bairstow and John Shaw
results.brief_description: Shows some of the variously adapted species of kangaroos in their natural environments: rat Kangaroos, quokkas, tree kangaroos, forest wallabies, rock wallabies and others. In Italian language.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, David Bairstow and John Shaw

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 2 [Italian version]
results.brief_description: Part Two examines various varieties of the Kangaroo, such as the Rat Kangaroo and the Quokkas. The manner in which the Kangaroo has been able to adapt its form to suit the peculiarities of a variety of environments is stressed. Some rare species are noted in the examination of the relationship between the animal and its habitat

results.title: Kangaroos. Part 1. Biography [Italian version]
results.brief_description: Part 1: Overviews the evolution of the Kangaroo, tracing its development over fifty species, from tree-dwellers to the better-known “Big Red”. The feeding, and mating habits of various species are examined, also birth and development in the pouch are studied

results.title: Kangaroos
results.brief_description: A study of the kangaroo and its habits. Shows activities of the herd, males fighting, protection of the young and foraging for food. No narration. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Kangaroo Island
results.creator_credit: South Australian Government Tourist Bureau and J.A. Correll
results.brief_description: A day on the Island, starting with fish being landed at dawn from the Kingscote Jetty. Includes visits to the friendly seals at Seal Bay and the kangaroos and koalas at Flinders Chase, the Remarkable Rocks, lighthouses and beaches. Water-skiing at American River, swimming at Penneshaw and a poolside party in the evening.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Government Tourist Bureau and J.A. Correll

results.title: Kangaroo Island
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation and Ron Lowe
results.brief_description: The Australian wildlife seen by visitors to Kangaroo Island, South Australia, is the subject of this award-winning film. Koalas, kangaroos, emus, pelicans and seals abound on this island sanctuary, completely unafraid of humans. Their daily activities form a fascinating study. Contains no commentary, only sounds of nature and background music composed by Bruce Smeaton. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
